meanings.definition: To withdraw more money from a bank account than is available
meanings.sent1: She overdraws her account when she spends too much money.
meanings.sent2: He realized he had overdrawn his account after trying to make a purchase.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel overdraws its acorn savings account and now has none left for winter!
meanings.sent4: Her love for shopping overdraws her bank account like a leaky faucet.
meanings.sent5: Overdrawing your account is like trying to fit a gallon of water into a pint-sized jar.

meanings.definition: To depict or describe in an exaggerated or excessive manner
meanings.sent1: The artist overdraws the features of the characters in his comic book.
meanings.sent2: The author tends to overdraw the emotions of the main character in her stories.
meanings.sent3: The comedian overdraws his jokes to make the audience laugh even harder.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement overdraws the reality of the situation, making it seem more dramatic.
meanings.sent5: The painter overdraws the sunset, making it look more vibrant and stunning.

meanings.definition: To pull or stretch something beyond its normal limits
meanings.sent1: He overdraws the rubber band until it snaps.
meanings.sent2: The weightlifter tends to overdraw his muscles during intense workouts.
meanings.sent3: The cat overdraws the yarn, leaving a tangled mess on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The storm overdraws the power lines, causing them to break under the strain.
meanings.sent5: Overdrawing a rubber band too much can lead to it losing its elasticity.
